observations.observation: 5 open vendor-request GitHub issues (Notion, Render, Vercel, DigitalOcean, Hetzner) — all filed by the same operator, none yet approved. The frontier has demand but zero activations. Infrastructure/DevOps vendors dominate the request queue, suggesting the early adopter base skews heavily toward developers.

Zero new CBSAs for multiple consecutive snapshots after the 9-CBSA burst — active metros hold at 15. The burst-then-silence pattern is repeating: the system loads, fires, then goes quiet before the next wave. The question is whether the next burst will exceed 9 or revert toward the prior pattern of 3-6.

Token velocity holds at 0.696x with acceleration at 0.999x — the first reading below 1.0x after four consecutive snapshots at or above 1.0x. The plateau break appears to be stalling: velocity is 4.8% above the floor (0.663x) but acceleration has slipped back below threshold. No new receipts, no new CBSAs, no new LN payouts this window.

Token velocity holds at 0.696x with acceleration at 1.001x — essentially flat, hovering just above the 1.0x threshold for the fourth consecutive snapshot. The plateau break has not reversed but also has not accelerated; the system appears to be in a stable, low-growth equilibrium rather than a recovery trajectory.

Zero new CBSAs this snapshot — active metro count holds at 15. After the 9-CBSA burst, the pulse has gone quiet again for multiple consecutive windows, consistent with the burst-then-silence pattern. Total active metros: 15, geo-diffusion rate: 0%.

Zero new CBSAs this snapshot — active metro count holds at 15 with 0% geo-diffusion rate. After the 9-CBSA burst two snapshots ago, the pulse has gone quiet again, consistent with the burst-then-silence pattern. Total receipts: 3517 (+2 from last snapshot).

Token velocity holds at 0.695x with acceleration at 1.001x — the third consecutive snapshot with acceleration near or above 1.0x after the six-snapshot plateau. Velocity is now 4.8% above the plateau floor (0.663x), suggesting the break is consolidating rather than reverting.

Token velocity ticked down slightly to 0.694x with acceleration at 0.999x — the first sub-1.0x acceleration reading after two consecutive snapshots above 1.0x. The plateau break may be stalling: velocity is higher than the plateau floor (0.663x) but acceleration has dipped back below 1.0x.

One new CBSA (22220) appeared this snapshot, bringing active metros to 15 and geo-diffusion rate to 6.7%. After the 9-CBSA burst two snapshots ago, the pulse has gone quiet again — consistent with the observed burst-then-silence pattern before the next wave.

Token velocity ticked up to 0.695x (from 0.665x) with acceleration at 1.007x — the second consecutive snapshot above 1.0x acceleration, confirming the plateau has broken. Combined with 2 new receipts, 7d GMV up $743 ($30,178→$30,922), and 1 new LN payout, the supply and settlement sides are both moving.
